required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Voriconazole for Secondary Prophylaxis of Invasive Fungal Infections in Patients With Allogeneic Stem Cell Transplants
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective, Open-Label, Non-Comparative, Multicenter Study for the Secondary Prophylaxis of Invasive Fungal Infections (IFI) With Voriconazole in Patients With Allogeneic Stem Cell Transplants (SCT).

collaborator.agency: European Group for Blood and Marrow Transplantation

brief_summary.textblock: To prevent recurrence of invasive fungal infection in patients with allogeneic stem cell transplants

primary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of Proven or Probable Invasive Fungal Infection (IFI): Start of Prophylaxis Until 12-month Follow-up Visit

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of Proven or Probable Invasive Fungal Infection (IFI): Start of Prophylaxis Until 6-month Follow-up Visit
Occurrence of Proven or Probable Invasive Fungal Infection (IFI): Start of Voriconazole Prophylaxis Until End of Prophylaxis Visit
Time to Occurrence of Proven or Probable Invasive Fungal Infection (IFI)
Time to Occurrence of Proven or Probable New (New Pathogen) Invasive Fungal Infection (IFI)
Time to Occurrence of Proven or Probable Recurrent Invasive Fungal Infection (IFI) (Same Pathogen as Previous Baseline IFI)
Survival Without Proven or Probable Invasive Fungal Infection (IFI)

intervention.description: Voriconazole is given to patients at least 48 hours after chemotherapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with proven or probable IFI in previous 12 months receiving an allogenic stem cell transplant for any haematological disease
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or lactating women
- Severe disease other tham the underlying condition
- Active, symptomatic uncontrolled Invasive Fungal Infection
- Any evidence of active fungal disease as defined by MSG-EORTC criteria
- Concomitant use of Voriconazole 36 hours before chemotherapy until 48 hours after chemotherapy
- Other medical conditions, including HIV positive serology that would interfere with the evaluation of therapeutic response or safety of study drug

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

clinical_study.keyword: Invasive Fungal Infection, Allogenic Stem Cell Transplant, prophylaxis, leukemia, voriconazole

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Subjects with proven or probable Invasive Fungal Infection (IFI) in the previous 12 months, who were receiving an allogeneic Stem Cell Transplant (SCT) for any hematologic disease, were enrolled into the study if all other inclusion/exclusion criteria were met.

group.title: Voriconazole
group.description: All subjects received voriconazole as study medication for prophylaxis, for a minimum of 100 days after transplant. Subjects received an intravenous (IV; 6 mg/kg)) or oral (PO; 400 mg) loading dose every 12 hours (q12h) for 2 doses, followed by maintenance (i.e., prophylactic) doses of 4 mg/kg IV q12h or 200 mg PO q12h, if the subject weighed ≥40 kg. If the subject weighed <40 kg, the PO loading dose was 200 mg PO q12h for 2 doses, followed by maintenance doses of 100 mg PO q12h.

group.title: Voriconazole
group.description: All subjects received voriconazole as study medication for prophylaxis, for a minimum of 100 days after transplant. Subjects received an intravenous (IV; 6 mg/kg)) or oral (PO; 400 mg) loading dose every 12 hours (q12h) for 2 doses, followed by maintenance (i.e., prophylactic) doses of 4 mg/kg IV q12h or 200 mg PO q12h, if the subject weighed ≥40 kg. If the subject weighed <40 kg, the PO loading dose was 200 mg PO q12h for 2 doses, followed by maintenance doses of 100 mg PO q12h.

outcome.title: Occurrence of Proven or Probable Invasive Fungal Infection (IFI): Start of Prophylaxis Until 12-month Follow-up Visit
outcome.description: Number of participants developing a proven or probable IFI from start of voriconazole prophylaxis until 12-month follow up
outcome.population: Complete case analysis (ie, outcome must be observed and/or subject must be evaluable for entire period of interest) using modified intent-to-treat (MITT) population (ie, subjects had at least 1 dose of voriconazole & at least 1 post-enrollment efficacy assessment & previous diagnosis of proven or probable IFI, confirmed by Data Review Committee).

group.title: Voriconazole

If the subject weighed <40 kg, the PO loading dose was 200 mg PO q12h for 2 doses, followed by maintenance doses of 100 mg PO q12h.

analysis.estimate_desc: Exact 95% Confidence Interval For Proportion; Expressed as a percentage

analysis.param_type: IFI Rate (percent) at End of Prophylaxis
analysis.estimate_desc: Exact 95% Confidence Interval For Proportion; Expressed as a percentage

outcome.title: Time to Occurrence of Proven or Probable Invasive Fungal Infection (IFI)
outcome.description: Time to occurrence of proven or probable IFI from the start of voriconazole prophylaxis. Time to occurrence is strictly time to recorded diagnosis of IFI since the exact day on which the IFI began will not be known.
outcome.population: Modified intent-to-treat (MITT) population (considered evaluable for efficacy) consisted of all subjects who had at least 1 dose of voriconazole & at least 1 post-enrollment efficacy assessment & had a previous diagnosis of proven or probable IFI, confirmed by the Data Review Committee. Three subjects in the MITT population experienced an IFI.

group.title: Voriconazole
group.description: All subjects received voriconazole as study medication for prophylaxis, for a minimum of 100 days after transplant. Subjects received an intravenous (IV; 6 mg/kg)) or oral (PO; 400 mg) loading dose every 12 hours (q12h) for 2 doses, followed by maintenance (i.e., prophylactic) doses of 4 mg/kg IV q12h or 200 mg PO q12h, if the subject weighed ≥40 kg. If the subject weighed <40 kg, the PO loading dose was 200 mg PO q12h for 2 doses, followed by maintenance doses of 100 mg PO q12h.

measure.title: Time to Occurrence of Proven or Probable Invasive Fungal Infection (IFI)
measure.description: Time to occurrence of proven or probable IFI from the start of voriconazole prophylaxis. Time to occurrence is strictly time to recorded diagnosis of IFI since the exact day on which the IFI began will not be known.
measure.population: Modified intent-to-treat (MITT) population (considered evaluable for efficacy) consisted of all subjects who had at least 1 dose of voriconazole & at least 1 post-enrollment efficacy assessment & had a previous diagnosis of proven or probable IFI, confirmed by the Data Review Committee. Three subjects in the MITT population experienced an IFI.

outcome.title: Time to Occurrence of Proven or Probable New (New Pathogen) Invasive Fungal Infection (IFI)
outcome.description: Time to occurrence of proven or probable new (new pathogen) IFI from the start of voriconazole prophylaxis. Time to occurrence is strictly time to recorded diagnosis of IFI.
outcome.population: Modified intent-to-treat (MITT) population (considered evaluable for efficacy) consisted of all subjects who had at least 1 dose of voriconazole & at least 1 post-enrollment efficacy assessment & had a previous diagnosis of proven or probable IFI, confirmed by the Data Review Committee. One subject in the MITT population experienced a new IFI.

group.title: Voriconazole
group.description: All subjects received voriconazole as study medication for prophylaxis, for a minimum of 100 days after transplant. Subjects received an intravenous (IV; 6 mg/kg)) or oral (PO; 400 mg) loading dose every 12 hours (q12h) for 2 doses, followed by maintenance (i.e., prophylactic) doses of 4 mg/kg IV q12h or 200 mg PO q12h, if the subject weighed ≥40 kg. If the subject weighed <40 kg, the PO loading dose was 200 mg PO q12h for 2 doses, followed by maintenance doses of 100 mg PO q12h.

measure.title: Time to Occurrence of Proven or Probable New (New Pathogen) Invasive Fungal Infection (IFI)
measure.description: Time to occurrence of proven or probable new (new pathogen) IFI from the start of voriconazole prophylaxis. Time to occurrence is strictly time to recorded diagnosis of IFI.
measure.population: Modified intent-to-treat (MITT) population (considered evaluable for efficacy) consisted of all subjects who had at least 1 dose of voriconazole & at least 1 post-enrollment efficacy assessment & had a previous diagnosis of proven or probable IFI, confirmed by the Data Review Committee. One subject in the MITT population experienced a new IFI.

outcome.title: Time to Occurrence of Proven or Probable Recurrent Invasive Fungal Infection (IFI) (Same Pathogen as Previous Baseline IFI)
outcome.description: Time to occurrence of proven or probable recurrent (same pathogen as baseline) IFI from the start of voriconazole prophylaxis. Time to occurrence is strictly time to recorded diagnosis of IFI. The pathogen identified as the positive culture recorded nearest to, but not after, the proven or probable IFI, was assumed to be responsible for the IFI.
outcome.population: Modified intent-to-treat (MITT) population (considered evaluable for efficacy) consisted of all subjects who had at least 1 dose of voriconazole & at least 1 post-enrollment efficacy assessment & had a previous diagnosis of proven or probable IFI, confirmed by the Data Review Committee. Two subjects experienced a recurrent proven or probable IFI.

group.title: Voriconazole
group.description: All subjects received voriconazole as study medication for prophylaxis, for a minimum of 100 days after transplant. Subjects received an intravenous (IV; 6 mg/kg)) or oral (PO; 400 mg) loading dose every 12 hours (q12h) for 2 doses, followed by maintenance (i.e., prophylactic) doses of 4 mg/kg IV q12h or 200 mg PO q12h, if the subject weighed ≥40 kg. If the subject weighed <40 kg, the PO loading dose was 200 mg PO q12h for 2 doses, followed by maintenance doses of 100 mg PO q12h.

measure.title: Time to Occurrence of Proven or Probable Recurrent Invasive Fungal Infection (IFI) (Same Pathogen as Previous Baseline IFI)
measure.description: Time to occurrence of proven or probable recurrent (same pathogen as baseline) IFI from the start of voriconazole prophylaxis. Time to occurrence is strictly time to recorded diagnosis of IFI. The pathogen identified as the positive culture recorded nearest to, but not after, the proven or probable IFI, was assumed to be responsible for the IFI.
measure.population: Modified intent-to-treat (MITT) population (considered evaluable for efficacy) consisted of all subjects who had at least 1 dose of voriconazole & at least 1 post-enrollment efficacy assessment & had a previous diagnosis of proven or probable IFI, confirmed by the Data Review Committee. Two subjects experienced a recurrent proven or probable IFI.

outcome.title: Survival Without Proven or Probable Invasive Fungal Infection (IFI)
outcome.description: Number of participants who survive (ie., are alive) without proven or probable IFI at each of the 6 and 12 month follow-up visits
outcome.population: Complete case analysis using MITT population (ie, all subjects who had at least 1 dose of study medication & at least 1 post-enrollment efficacy assessment & a previous diagnosis of proven or probable IFI, confirmed by Data Review Committee) & either provided an IFI assessment at follow-up visit, died or experienced an IFI before that visit.

group.title: Voriconazole
group.description: All subjects received voriconazole as study medication for prophylaxis, for a minimum of 100 days after transplant. Subjects received an intravenous (IV; 6 mg/kg)) or oral (PO; 400 mg) loading dose every 12 hours (q12h) for 2 doses, followed by maintenance (i.e., prophylactic) doses of 4 mg/kg IV q12h or 200 mg PO q12h, if the subject weighed ≥40 kg. If the subject weighed <40 kg, the PO loading dose was 200 mg PO q12h for 2 doses, followed by maintenance doses of 100 mg PO q12h.

measure.title: Survival Without Proven or Probable Invasive Fungal Infection (IFI)
measure.description: Number of participants who survive (ie., are alive) without proven or probable IFI at each of the 6 and 12 month follow-up visits
measure.population: Complete case analysis using MITT population (ie, all subjects who had at least 1 dose of study medication & at least 1 post-enrollment efficacy assessment & a previous diagnosis of proven or probable IFI, confirmed by Data Review Committee) & either provided an IFI assessment at follow-up visit, died or experienced an IFI before that visit.

class.title: survived free of IFI until 6 months
survived free of IFI until 12 months

analysis.estimate_desc: Exact 95% Confidence Interval For Proportion; Expressed as a percentage

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of < 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), < 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential info other than study results.
